p: Oregano ( Origanum vulgare L. subsp. vulgare) is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe and Asia. The main constituents of the essential oil in its leaves are carvacrol, p-cymene, c-terpinene, limonene, terpinene, ocimene, caryophyllene, Î²-bisabolene, linalool, and 4-terpineol [ 64]. Oregano is added for its slightly bitter flavor to poultry, fish, and other dishes. O. vulgare L. subsp. viridulum (Martrin-Donos) Nyman is also reported as a wild spice.
